name: tris(3-methoxyphenyl)phosphine
Reason: 3-methoxyphenyl groups, when connected to a phosphine base, significantly increase the melting point due to the introduction of additional rigid structures and hydrogen bonding potential. Each methoxy group introduces additional molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at approximately +10°C. The phosphine base itself also contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at approximately +20°C. The presence of three methoxyphenyl groups raises the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential.
